Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the ease with which anyone can buy any weapon without much regulation, including machine guns. This is not accurate as machine guns have been tightly regulated and banned since 1986.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that machine guns have been tightly regulated since 1934 and banned since 1986.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that anyone can buy any weapon without much regulation.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that there are no regulations or restrictions on the purchase of weapons, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation to the claim is that while there may be some loopholes or gaps in the regulation of firearms, the overall system still imposes significant restrictions on the purchase and ownership of certain weapons.
